verses.text: Wisdom will praise herself, and in the midst of her people she will boast.
verses.comment: Personification of Wisdom recalls Proverbs. Here, Wisdom is portrayed as an active, divine figure, foreshadowing Christ as the ultimate wisdom (1 Cor. 1:30).

verses.text: In the assembly of the Most High she will open her mouth, and in the presence of his power she will glory.
verses.comment: Wisdom speaks publicly before God. This mirrors the role of Christ, proclaiming truth before God and man (John 18:20).

verses.text: I came forth from the mouth of the Most High, and I covered the earth like a mist.
verses.comment: Wisdom is depicted as proceeding from God—an image many see fulfilled in Christ, the Word made flesh (John 1:1-14).

verses.text: I dwelt in high places, and my throne was in a pillar of cloud.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s dwelling in the cloud recalls God’s presence in the Exodus. It hints at the mystery of God dwelling among His people.

verses.text: I alone encompassed the circle of heaven, and walked in the depths of the abyss.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s universal reach points to God’s sovereignty and the fullness found in divine Wisdom incarnate.

verses.text: Over waves of the sea, and over all the earth, and over every people and nation I held sway.
verses.comment: Universal authority, prefigures Christ’s claim over all nations (Matt. 28:18-19).

verses.text: Among all these I sought a resting place, and in whose inheritance should I abide?
verses.comment: Wisdom seeks a home, similar to God choosing Zion as His dwelling. Spiritually, this foreshadows the indwelling presence of God in His people.

verses.text: 'Then the Creator of all commanded me, and he who created me assigned a place for my tent. He said, ‘Make your dwelling in Jacob, and in Israel receive your inheritance.’
verses.comment: Wisdom is settled in Israel, the chosen people. The language reflects divine election and the establishment of God's enduring presence.

verses.text: Before all ages, from the beginning, he created me, and through all ages I shall not cease to be.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s eternity parallels the eternal Word. Christ in Christian tradition is 'begotten, not made'—concepts deeply rooted in early theology.

verses.text: In the holy tent I ministered before him, and so I was established in Zion.
verses.comment: Wisdom ministers in the sanctuary, echoing the role of priests. This points to the importance of sacramental life and worship.

verses.text: He made me dwell in the beloved city, and in Jerusalem was my authority.
verses.comment: Jerusalem as the seat of Wisdom prefigures its role in messianic prophecy and the new covenant.

verses.text: I took root among a noble people, in the portion of the Lord, in his inheritance.
verses.comment: Wisdom firmly rooted in Israel, echoing the tradition of faith being handed down through generations.

verses.text: I grew tall like a cedar in Lebanon, and like a cypress on the heights of Hermon.
verses.comment: Tall trees symbolize majesty, longevity, and divine blessing—a fitting image for Wisdom.

verses.text: I spread my branches like a palm tree in En-Gedi, and like rose bushes in Jericho.
verses.comment: Imagery of fruitfulness and beauty, reminiscent of the Song of Songs, which uses garden language to describe spiritual intimacy.

verses.text: I am like an olive tree blossoming in the field, and like a plane tree growing by the water.
verses.comment: Olive trees signify peace and steadfastness; water evokes the Spirit and baptism.

verses.text: I gave forth fragrance like cinnamon and aspalathus, and I spread my aroma like choice myrrh.
verses.comment: Fragrant imagery points to spiritual delight and holiness—echoing themes seen in liturgical life and sacramental grace.

verses.text: I gave sweetness like honey from the comb, and my taste was like choice honey from the hive.
verses.comment: Honey represents wisdom’s sweetness and spiritual nourishment; similar imagery in Psalm 119 and Proverbs.

verses.text: My memory is sweeter than honey, and my inheritance better than the honeycomb.
verses.comment: Those who remember Wisdom gain more than worldly reward; hints at storing up treasures in heaven (Matt. 6:20).

verses.text: Those who eat of me will hunger for more, and those who drink of me will thirst for more.
verses.comment: Wisdom as food and drink prefigures Christ as the Bread of Life (John 6:35), cultivated through sacramental participation.

verses.text: Whoever obeys me will never be put to shame, and those who work with me will not sin.
verses.comment: Living by Wisdom keeps one from sin—emphasizes grace-enabled perseverance.

verses.text: All these are the book of the Most High’s covenant, the Law which Moses commanded as an inheritance to the assemblies of Jacob.
verses.comment: Law as inheritance—a theme fulfilled and expanded in the New Covenant (Heb. 8:6-13).

verses.text: He made me grow in the tent of Jacob, and in the presence of my beloved he poured out my roots.
verses.comment: Rooted language hints at continuity in worship and tradition. Spiritual growth flourishes in the place God dwells.

verses.text: I spread out branches like a terebinth, and my branches are branches of glory and grace.
verses.comment: Terebinth trees are associated with covenant. Branches of glory and grace recall the spiritual fruits brought forth in the church.

verses.text: Like a vine I produced lovely shoots, and my blossoms gave forth rich fruit.
verses.comment: The vine metaphor, prominent in John 15, symbolizes union with Christ and the fruitfulness of abiding in Him.

verses.text: Come to me, you who desire me, and be filled with my fruits.
verses.comment: Invitation echoes Proverbs 9 and Jesus’ teaching on spiritual hunger in the Gospels. Fulfillment is found in living communion.

verses.text: For my spirit is sweeter than honey, and my inheritance greater than the honeycomb.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s spirit surpasses natural sweetness; the inheritance language highlights spiritual and eternal rewards.

verses.text: Those who eat of me will hunger for more, and those who drink of me will thirst for more.
verses.comment: Repetition underscores desire for spiritual wisdom, leading to deeper participation in divine life.

verses.text: Whoever obeys me will not be put to shame, and whoever works with me will not sin.
verses.comment: Obedience to Wisdom assures spiritual integrity and virtue, ideal for followers seeking to live in grace.

verses.text: All this is the book of the covenant of the Most High God, the Law which Moses commanded for an inheritance to the assemblies of Jacob.
verses.comment: Reiteration of the Law as the guide for God’s people, linking wisdom to covenant faithfulness.

verses.text: Do not cease to grow strong in the Lord, but be confident in him, that he may strengthen you.
verses.comment: Encouragement to perseverance in faith, rooted in trust in God’s strengthening power.

verses.text: You will be filled if you keep my commandments; if you love me, you will inherit all things.
verses.comment: Obedience and love go together. Spiritual inheritance is promised to those who keep the commandments—echoing Christ’s words.

verses.text: From the beginning I revealed myself to all the holy ones, to whom the Lord apportioned his inheritance.
verses.comment: Wisdom revealed to the 'holy ones'—aligns with the historical continuity of God’s revelation through chosen people and leaders.

verses.text: I will yet pour out teaching like prophecy, and leave it to all coming generations.
verses.comment: Wisdom's teaching endures, anticipating the prophecy of the new covenant written on hearts (Jer. 31:33).

verses.text: See that I have not labored for myself only, but for all who seek wisdom.
verses.comment: Wisdom is universally available for all who seek her, encouraging further pursuit through tradition, sacraments, and community.
